question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increasing by more than 0.1% in July 2024, we need to consider several factors: Historical trends indicate that the Month-over-Month Core CPI has frequently exceeded 0.1%. In 2022 and 2023, increases of 0.3% to 0.6% were common. Recent data shows a gradual moderation in inflation rates, but core inflation has been more persistent. The Federal Reserve's aggressive interest rate hikes are expected to reduce inflationary pressures by July 2024. Economic conditions, including wage growth and consumer demand, will also impact inflation. Seasonal factors in July typically lead to price increases, but these are accounted for in seasonally adjusted figures. Long-term inflation expectations remain stable, which helps anchor actual inflation. While a 0.1% monthly increase in core CPI translates to about 1.2% annually, which is below the Fed's target, it is likely that core inflation will remain above this level. Therefore, while there's a good chance of core CPI increasing by more than 0.1%, there's also a substantial possibility of lower inflation due to ongoing policy effects and economic adjustments.

question.title: Given the US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value. Then, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024? This resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of this scenario, we need to consider several factors: 1. Economic impact: While a Core CPI increase of more than 0.1% in July 2024 would be concerning, it's not an extreme economic event that would typically trigger a constitutional crisis. 2. Biden's health: As of now (July 2024), there are no public indications of severe health issues that would warrant invoking the 25th Amendment. While Biden is the oldest serving president, his team has consistently maintained that he is fit for office. 3. Political climate: Invoking Section 4 of the 25th Amendment is an extreme measure that would likely only be considered in cases of severe incapacitation. It would require the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet to agree, which is a high bar to clear. 4. Time frame: The window for this to occur is very short - essentially just the month of July 2024. This leaves little time for a drastic change in circumstances. 5. Precedent: The 25th Amendment Section 4 has never been invoked in U.S. history. Its use would be unprecedented and would likely only occur in extreme circumstances. 6. Correlation: There's no direct logical connection between a CPI increase and presidential incapacitation. While economic factors can influence political decisions, they don't directly impact a president's ability to serve. 7. Election year considerations: 2024 is a presidential election year. Invoking the 25th Amendment so close to an election would be extremely controversial and potentially damaging to the Democratic Party. Given these factors, it seems highly unlikely that Biden would be declared incapacitated under these circumstances. While not impossible, it would require an extraordinary and unforeseen series of events to occur within a very short timeframe.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024 (b) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context for (b): GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider both parts (a) and (b) separately and then combine their probabilities. (a) US Core CPI increase in July 2024: The Core CPI (Consumer Price Index excluding food and energy) is a key measure of inflation. Historically, month-over-month increases of more than 0.1% are common, but not guaranteed. In recent years, the Federal Reserve has been working to control inflation, which could lead to lower increases. However, economic conditions can change rapidly, and predicting inflation a year in advance is challenging. Given the current trend and the Fed's efforts, a 0.1% increase seems plausible but not certain. I would estimate the probability of this occurring at around 60%. (b) Biden declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment: This is a much less likely scenario. The 25th Amendment has never been invoked to remove a president involuntarily. While there have been concerns about President Biden's age and occasional gaffes, there's no concrete evidence of incapacity. The mention of a GOP lawmaker asking to invoke the 25th Amendment is more likely political posturing than a serious threat. For this to occur, it would require agreement from the Vice President and a majority of Biden's own Cabinet, which is highly improbable barring a severe and sudden health crisis. I would estimate the probability of this occurring before August 2024 at less than 1%, perhaps around 0.1%. For both events to occur, we need to multiply these probabilities: 0.60 * 0.001 = 0.0006 or 0.06%. This extremely low probability reflects the unlikelihood of both events occurring together, primarily due to the very low probability of Biden being declared incapacitated.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of Joe Biden dropping out of the presidential race before July 20, 2024, we need to consider several factors: 1. Current status: As of now, Biden is the incumbent president and the presumptive Democratic nominee for the 2024 election. He has officially announced his re-election campaign and has the support of the Democratic Party leadership. 2. Age and health: Biden will be 81 years old on Election Day 2024, making him the oldest president in U.S. history. While his health has been generally good, concerns about his age and stamina persist. However, there have been no recent indications of serious health issues that would force him to drop out. 3. Political landscape: Biden's approval ratings have been relatively low, but not catastrophically so. The Democratic Party doesn't have a clear alternative candidate who could step in if Biden were to drop out. 4. Time frame: The question asks about the period from now until July 20, 2024, which is before the Democratic National Convention (typically held in August). It's unusual for an incumbent president to drop out this late in the process. 5. Historical precedent: It's extremely rare for an incumbent president to drop out of a re-election race, especially this close to the election. The last time it happened was Lyndon B. Johnson in 1968, under very different circumstances. 6. Biden's commitment: Biden has repeatedly stated his intention to run for re-election and has shown no signs of wavering from this position. Given these factors, it seems highly unlikely that Biden would drop out before July 20, 2024. While there's always a possibility due to unforeseen circumstances (such as a sudden health crisis), the probability is quite low. The most likely scenario is that Biden continues his campaign as planned.

question.title: Given Biden drops out before July 20, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves to yes if Biden drops out or is unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question resolves "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. It strictly pertains to the status as of July 15, 2024, and does not account for legal battles, appeals, or reversals after this date.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. Likelihood of Biden dropping out: While it's possible, it seems unlikely that Biden would drop out before July 20, 2024, given his current position as the incumbent president and presumptive Democratic nominee. 2. Legal challenges to Trump's eligibility: There have been ongoing discussions and legal challenges regarding Trump's eligibility under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment due to his alleged role in the January 6 Capitol riot. However, as of now, no state has successfully removed or blocked Trump from the ballot on these grounds. 3. Timeline: Even if Biden were to drop out, the time between his hypothetical withdrawal and July 15, 2024 (when the question resolves) is relatively short for a state to successfully remove or block Trump from the ballot. 4. State-by-state variation: Different states have different processes and timelines for determining ballot eligibility, and some may be more likely than others to attempt to remove Trump based on the 14th Amendment. 5. Legal hurdles: Removing a major candidate from a ballot is a significant action that would likely face immediate legal challenges, potentially delaying any final decision beyond July 15, 2024. 6. Precedent: As of now, no presidential candidate has ever been removed from a ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, making such an action unprecedented and legally complex. Given these factors, while it's not impossible for a state to remove or block Trump from the ballot under these circumstances, it seems unlikely to occur by July 15, 2024. The short timeline, legal complexities, and unprecedented nature of such an action make it a low probability event.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
question.body: (a) This condition will be met if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. (b) This condition will be met if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider the likelihood of two separate events occurring, as both conditions must be met for the question to resolve as YES. 1. Biden dropping out before July 20, 2024: Currently, there's no strong indication that President Biden intends to drop out of the 2024 race. He has announced his re-election campaign and seems committed to running. However, concerns about his age and health persist. While it's possible he could drop out due to unforeseen health issues or political pressure, it's relatively unlikely given his current stance and the lack of a clear Democratic alternative. Probability for this event: ~10% 2. Donald Trump being removed or blocked from any state's primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024: This is a more complex issue. There have been discussions and some legal attempts to use the 14th Amendment to disqualify Trump from running due to his alleged role in the January 6th Capitol riot. However, as of now, no state has successfully removed him from the ballot on these grounds. While legal challenges are ongoing, it's uncertain whether any will succeed, especially given the potential for appeals and the politically contentious nature of such a move. Probability for this event: ~20% For both events to occur, we need to multiply these probabilities: 0.10 * 0.20 = 0.02 or 2%. However, we should also consider that these events are not entirely independent. If one occurs, it might slightly increase the likelihood of the other (e.g., if Trump is removed from ballots, it might reduce pressure on Biden to continue running). This could marginally increase the joint probability.

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess Poland's chances of qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, we need to consider several factors: historical performance, recent performance, quality of entry, voting patterns, semi-final allocation, changes in format or voting system, and the method of selection. Poland has qualified for the Grand Final in 8 out of 17 attempts since the introduction of semi-finals, giving them a qualification rate of about 47%. In the last five years, they qualified three times, showing a slightly improved recent performance. However, without knowing the specific entry or semi-final allocation, it's difficult to be highly confident. Given these factors, I would estimate that Poland has a slightly better than even chance of qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024.

question.title: Given Poland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Ireland also qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Ireland also qualify for the Grand Final? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of Ireland qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, given that Poland has qualified, we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical performance: Ireland has a strong Eurovision history, having won the contest 7 times. However, their recent performance has been less impressive. They failed to qualify for the final in 2022 and 2023. 2. Semi-final structure: Eurovision typically has two semi-finals, with 10 countries qualifying from each. The total number of countries in each semi-final is usually around 16-18. This means that roughly 55-60% of countries in each semi-final qualify. 3. Poland's qualification: While Poland's qualification doesn't directly impact Ireland's chances, it might indicate the general competitiveness of the semi-final they're in (assuming they're in the same one). 4. Ireland's current music industry: The strength of Ireland's entry will depend on the quality of the song and performer they select, which is unknown at this time. 5. Voting patterns: Ireland often receives support from the UK due to cultural ties, which can help in the voting process. 6. Qualification rate: In recent years, Ireland has qualified for the final in about 30-40% of their attempts. Given these factors, Ireland's chances of qualifying are not particularly high, but also not negligible. Their recent track record is poor, but their historical success and potential for a strong entry keep their chances somewhat reasonable. The fact that Poland has qualified doesn't significantly alter Ireland's chances, as it's more dependent on Ireland's own performance and the overall competition in their semi-final. Considering all these factors, I would estimate Ireland's chances of qualifying to be slightly below the average qualification rate, but not drastically so.

question.title: Will both Poland and Ireland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Ireland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Poland or Ireland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of both Poland and Ireland qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, we need to consider several factors: Historical performance: Poland has qualified for the Grand Final in 7 out of 15 attempts since the introduction of semi-finals in 2004. Ireland has qualified for the Grand Final in 6 out of 15 attempts in the same period. Recent trends: Poland failed to qualify in 2023 but had qualified in the three previous contests (2019, 2021, 2022). Ireland has struggled recently, failing to qualify in the last four contests (2019, 2021, 2022, 2023). Eurovision voting patterns: Poland often receives support from diaspora votes in countries like the UK and Germany. Ireland, despite being a historic powerhouse (7 wins), has struggled to adapt to modern Eurovision trends. Unpredictability of Eurovision: Song quality, performance, and staging can significantly impact results, and these are unknown at this point. The semi-final draw can also affect qualification chances. Motivation to perform well: Both countries have a strong interest in the contest and are likely to put effort into their entries. Competition level: The overall quality of entries in recent years has been high, making qualification more challenging. Considering these factors, Poland seems to have a better chance of qualifying than Ireland based on recent performance. Given Poland's recent success rate and Ireland's struggles, I would estimate the chances of both qualifying to be lower than 50%. question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of Scotland holding an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024, we need to consider several factors: 1. Current political climate: The Scottish National Party (SNP), which supports independence, remains the dominant political force in Scotland. However, they do not have an outright majority in the Scottish Parliament. 2. UK Government stance: The UK Government, led by the Conservative Party, has consistently opposed a second independence referendum, arguing that the 2014 vote was a 'once in a generation' event. 3. Legal barriers: The UK Supreme Court ruled in November 2022 that the Scottish Parliament does not have the power to legislate for a referendum without Westminster's consent. 4. Time constraints: With the resolution date of May 3, 2024, there is very little time left to organize a referendum, even if permission were granted immediately. 5. Public opinion: While support for independence has fluctuated, recent polls do not show an overwhelming majority in favor, which might reduce pressure for an immediate referendum. 6. International context: Brexit has changed the landscape since the 2014 referendum, but its full impact on independence sentiment is still evolving. 7. Economic factors: The economic case for independence is still debated, and current global economic uncertainties might make a referendum less appealing in the short term. 8. Precedent: The UK Government allowed the 2014 referendum through a Section 30 order, but has shown no willingness to repeat this process. Given these factors, particularly the legal ruling, the UK Government's opposition, and the very short timeframe remaining, it seems highly unlikely that an official, sanctioned referendum will take place before May 3, 2024. The requirement for UK Government consent is a significant hurdle that appears insurmountable in the given timeframe.

question.title: Will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess Georgia's chances of qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical performance: Georgia has participated in Eurovision since 2007 but has had mixed results. They've qualified for the Grand Final 7 out of 14 times, which gives them about a 50% success rate historically. 2. Recent performance: Georgia failed to qualify for the Grand Final in 2021, 2022, and 2023. This recent trend is concerning and suggests they may be struggling to connect with voters and juries. 3. Semi-final allocation: The semi-final in which Georgia is placed can affect their chances. We don't know this information yet for 2024. 4. Song quality and performance: The quality of Georgia's entry for 2024 is unknown at this time, which is a significant factor in determining qualification chances. 5. Voting patterns: Georgia often receives support from Eastern European countries and former Soviet states, but this hasn't been enough to guarantee qualification in recent years. 6. Competition level: The overall quality of entries in their semi-final will impact Georgia's chances, but this is also unknown at this time. 7. Changes in format or voting: Any potential changes to the Eurovision format or voting system could affect qualification chances, but no major changes have been announced for 2024. 8. Potential for improvement: Given their recent poor performance, Georgia may be motivated to send a stronger entry in 2024 to improve their chances. Considering these factors, especially the recent trend of non-qualification and the uncertainties surrounding their 2024 entry, I would estimate that Georgia's chances of qualifying for the Grand Final are slightly below 50%. However, there's still a reasonable chance they could qualify with a strong entry and favorable semi-final placement.

The two countries' fates are not directly linked, and Estonia's qualification will depend on its own performance and the competition in its semi-final.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of Joe Biden announcing he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President before July 15, 2024, we need to consider several factors: 1. Incumbent advantage: Historically, sitting presidents rarely decline to run for a second term unless faced with significant challenges or health issues. 2. Biden's age and health: At 81 years old (as of 2024), Biden is already the oldest serving president. Concerns about his age and mental acuity have been raised, which could potentially influence his decision. 3. Current political climate: As of now, Biden has not given any strong indications that he plans to step aside. He has repeatedly stated his intention to run for re-election. 4. Time frame: The question's resolution date is relatively close to the Democratic National Convention (typically held in July or August). It's unlikely that Biden would wait until so late in the election cycle to make such a significant announcement. 5. Party support: The Democratic Party leadership has largely rallied behind Biden, and there are no prominent challengers within the party. 6. Polling and approval ratings: While Biden's approval ratings have fluctuated, they haven't dropped to levels that would typically force an incumbent to step aside. 7. Policy agenda: Biden has ongoing policy initiatives and goals that he likely wants to continue pursuing in a second term. 8. International context: Given global challenges and the need for stability in U.S. leadership, there might be pressure for Biden to continue. Given these factors, it seems highly unlikely that Biden would announce he won't accept the nomination. The only scenarios where this might happen would be a sudden, severe health issue or an unforeseen political crisis. While these are possible, they are not probable.

question.title: Given Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Russia control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

Russian military capabilities: Russia has shown the ability to sustain a long-term conflict but has also faced significant challenges in making substantial territorial gains. 7. Given these factors, it seems unlikely that Russia would control Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024. question.title: Will Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both the winner of the men's and winner's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical performance: Kalenjin athletes have dominated long-distance running, particularly marathons, for decades. They have consistently performed well in Olympic marathons. 2. Recent trends: In the 2020 Tokyo Olympics (held in 2021), Eliud Kipchoge (a Kalenjin) won the men's marathon, but Peres Jepchirchir (also Kalenjin) won the women's marathon. This shows continued Kalenjin dominance in both categories. 3. Current top performers: As of 2023, many of the world's top marathon runners are of Kalenjin origin. This includes Eliud Kipchoge (men's world record holder) and Brigid Kosgei (former women's world record holder). 4. Genetic and environmental factors: The Kalenjin people are known for their natural endurance running abilities, attributed to both genetic factors and their high-altitude training environment in Kenya's Rift Valley. 5. Competition: While Kalenjin runners are strong, there are excellent marathon runners from other ethnicities and countries, including Ethiopia, Japan, and European nations. 6. Unpredictability of sports: Olympic performances can be affected by various factors such as weather conditions, injuries, or unexpected breakout performances from other athletes. 7. Time until the event: The Olympics are still about a year away, which leaves room for changes in form, injuries, or new talents emerging. Given these factors, I believe there is a strong chance of Kalenjin athletes winning both marathons, but it's not a certainty. Their historical dominance and current top performances give them an edge, but the unpredictability of sports and strong competition from other nations prevent this from being a near-certain outcome.

question.title: Given Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races, will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. If both the men's and women's marathon winners are of Kalenjin descent, it confirms their continued dominance in this event. 2. Swimming events at the Olympics: Swimming is one of the sports with the most medal events at the Olympics. In Tokyo 2020, there were 35 swimming events (18 for men, 18 for women, and 3 mixed relays). 3. Multiple medal opportunities in swimming: Unlike marathon running, where an athlete typically competes in only one event, swimmers often compete in multiple events, increasing their chances of winning multiple medals. 4. Historical performance: In recent Olympics, swimmers have often been among the top medal winners. For example, Michael Phelps (USA) and Katie Ledecky (USA) have been dominant forces in swimming, winning multiple gold medals in single Olympic Games. 5. Current swimming stars: While we don't know the exact form of swimmers in 2024, there are several talented swimmers who could potentially win multiple gold medals, such as Caeleb Dressel (USA), Emma McKeon (Australia), or emerging talents. 6. Competition from other sports: We should consider potential multiple gold medal winners from other sports like gymnastics, athletics (track and field), or cycling. However, swimming generally offers more opportunities for multiple medals than most other sports. 7. Timing of the question: The question is asked after the marathon events but before the end of the Olympics, suggesting that swimming events (which typically occur earlier in the Olympic schedule) have likely already taken place. Given these factors, it seems quite likely that a swimmer would win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The multiple event nature of swimming, combined with the historical precedent of swimmers being top medal winners, makes this a strong possibility. The fact that Kalenjin athletes won both marathon events doesn't significantly impact this likelihood, as marathon runners typically only compete in one event. However, there's always a chance of an exceptional performance in another sport or an unexpected outcome, so we can't be entirely certain.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of this scenario, we need to consider several factors: 1. Likelihood of Biden dropping out: As the incumbent president, it's generally unlikely for Biden to drop out unless there are significant health issues or major political scandals. Currently, there are no strong indications of either. 2. Media landscape and competition: Major news outlets are highly competitive and always looking for breaking news. If there were hints of Biden dropping out, these outlets would be actively investigating and seeking confirmation. 3. White House information control: The Biden administration would likely try to control the narrative around such a significant decision. However, leaks from insiders are always possible. 4. Time frame: The question specifies at least 6 hours of advance coverage. This is a relatively short window, which increases the likelihood of media coverage if a dropout were to occur. 5. Reliability of sources: Major outlets mentioned (AP, CNN, NYT, WSJ, Fox, Reuters, WaPo) are generally cautious about publishing unconfirmed news, especially regarding such a consequential event. They would likely need multiple reliable sources before publishing. 6. Historical precedent: There's no recent precedent for a sitting president dropping out of a re-election campaign, making it difficult to predict how such news would unfold. Given these factors, if Biden were to drop out (which is itself unlikely), there's a good chance that at least one major outlet would report it in advance. The competitive nature of news media and the significance of such an event make it probable that information would leak and be reported before an official announcement. However, the overall probability is low because it's contingent on Biden actually dropping out, which is unlikely in itself.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) If Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance, AND (2) Donald Trump Jr. becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

(2) This resolves YES if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the election day.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of both events occurring, we need to consider each part separately and then combine their likelihoods. 1. Probability for this part: ~0.01 (1%) For both events to occur, we need to multiply these probabilities: 0.05 * 0.01 = 0.0005 or 0.05%. This extremely low probability reflects the highly unlikely nature of both events occurring together. Each event is improbable on its own, and the combination of both is even more so.

question.title: Conditional on Inflection publishing a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of Francis Suarez becoming the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, we need to consider several factors: 1. These candidates have much higher name recognition and established support bases. 3. Party dynamics: The Republican Party tends to favor candidates with strong conservative credentials and national recognition. Suarez, as a moderate and lesser-known figure, may struggle to gain traction with the party base. Given these factors, it appears highly unlikely that Francis Suarez would be selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. While unexpected events can always occur in politics, the current landscape suggests that Suarez has an extremely low chance of securing the nomination.

question.title: Conditional on Francis Suarez being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will 538 project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:

If Biden is projected as the favorite, the answer is YES. If Trump is projected as the favorite, the answer is NO. If both have equal odds, the resolution is 50-50. If no data is available for July 19, the nearest previous figures will be used.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. They tend to give significant weight to name recognition and established political track records. 4. Hypothetical scenario: The question assumes Suarez becomes the Republican nominee, which would be a surprising outcome given the current political landscape. This suggests a potential shift in Republican party dynamics or unforeseen events that could impact the overall election forecast. 5. Biden's current approval ratings: While these have fluctuated, they would likely impact the forecast to some degree. Given these factors, I believe Biden would likely be favored in this scenario for the following reasons: a) Incumbency advantage: Historically, incumbent presidents have a higher chance of re-election. b) Name recognition: Biden would have a significant advantage over Suarez in terms of national recognition. c) Experience: Biden's experience as President and Vice President would likely be viewed favorably compared to Suarez's experience as a mayor. d) Party support: The hypothetical scenario of Suarez becoming the nominee might indicate some fragmentation within the Republican party, potentially benefiting Biden. However, there are uncertainties: a) Potential shifts in public opinion between now and July 2024. b) Unknown factors that could lead to Suarez becoming the nominee, which might also impact his general election chances. c) Possible changes in the economic or geopolitical situation that could affect Biden's approval ratings. Given these considerations, I believe Biden would be favored, but not overwhelmingly so.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of 'Deadpool & Wolverine' surpassing the combined opening box office of 'Deadpool' and 'The Wolverine,' we need to consider several factors: 1. Franchise popularity: Both Deadpool and Wolverine are extremely popular characters in the Marvel universe, with strong fan bases. 2. Previous performance: 'Deadpool' had an exceptional opening of $132,434,639, while 'The Wolverine' opened at $53,113,752. The combined target to beat is $185,548,391. 3. Synergy effect: Combining these two popular characters in one film is likely to create significant buzz and attract fans of both characters, potentially leading to a larger audience than either character alone. 4. Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) integration: This film is expected to integrate these characters into the MCU, which could draw additional interest from the broader Marvel fanbase. 5. Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman: Both actors are immensely popular and their on-screen chemistry and off-screen friendship have been widely publicized, adding to the film's appeal. 6. Inflation and ticket prices: Since 2013 and 2016, movie ticket prices have increased, which naturally inflates box office numbers. 7. Post-pandemic box office recovery: While the movie industry has been recovering from the pandemic, blockbuster films have been performing particularly well. 8. Marketing and hype: Given the star power and anticipation, the marketing campaign is likely to be extensive, building significant hype. 9. Release date: The film is set for a summer release (July 26, 2024), which is typically a strong period for box office performance. 10. Competition: Without knowing the full summer 2024 release schedule, it's hard to gauge competition, but this film is likely to be one of the season's biggest draws. Given these factors, especially the combined star power, the integration into the MCU, and the summer release date, it seems highly likely that 'Deadpool & Wolverine' will surpass the combined opening weekend of its predecessors. The synergy of combining these characters should result in an opening significantly larger than either previous film individually. However, we must also consider potential risks such as unexpected competition, changes in audience tastes, or unforeseen events that could impact theater attendance.

question.title: Given "Deadpool & Wolverine" domestic box office opening exceeds the combined openings of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine", will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" receive a CinemaScore of B or above?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" is higher than the combined domestic box office openings of "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013), which is $185,548,391 in total, as reported by Boxofficemojo.

Given this condition, will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B or above?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: "Deadpool & Wolverine" must have a domestic box office opening higher than $185,548,391.
- For the outcome: "Trap" must receive a B CinemaScore or higher to resolve YES, and a B- or lower to resolve NO. If no CinemaScore is reported, it resolves N/A.

Context:
- "Trap" is directed by M. Night Shyamalan, known for films like "Split" (B+), "Glass" (B), "Old" (C+), and "Knock at the Cabin" (C).

metadata.chain_of_thought:
To answer this question, we need to consider several factors:

1. Box Office Performance: The condition of "Deadpool & Wolverine" surpassing $185,548,391 in its domestic opening is quite likely. Both Deadpool and Wolverine are extremely popular characters, and their combined movie is highly anticipated. This suggests a strong audience interest, which could correlate with positive reception.

2. M. Night Shyamalan's Track Record: Shyamalan has a mixed history with CinemaScores. His recent films have ranged from B+ ("Split") to C ("Knock at the Cabin"). This shows variability in audience reception of his work.

3. Genre and Expectations: "Trap" is likely to be a thriller or horror film, given Shyamalan's usual style. These genres often receive lower CinemaScores due to their divisive nature, even when critically acclaimed.

4. Audience Expectations: Shyamalan is known for his twist endings and unconventional storytelling. Regular moviegoers are likely aware of this and may adjust their expectations accordingly, which could lead to more favorable reactions.

5. Recent Trend: Shyamalan's last four mentioned films show a declining trend in CinemaScores (B+, B, C+, C). This could indicate a growing disconnect between his style and general audience preferences.

6. Title and Marketing: The title "Trap" suggests a suspenseful or horror-themed movie, which aligns with audience expectations for a Shyamalan film. This alignment of expectations and delivery could lead to more positive audience reactions.

7. Correlation with "Deadpool & Wolverine": There's no direct causal link between the success of "Deadpool & Wolverine" and the reception of "Trap". However, a strong opening for the former might indicate a generally positive mood among moviegoers, which could slightly benefit other films.

Considering these factors, it seems that "Trap" has a decent chance of receiving a CinemaScore of B or above, but it's far from certain. Shyamalan's recent trend is concerning, but his name still carries weight, and if he delivers a film that meets or exceeds audience expectations, a B score is achievable. However, the unpredictable nature of his films and the typically lower scores for the thriller/horror genre add significant uncertainty.

4. Inflation since 2016 means ticket prices are higher.

(b) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" CinemaScore:

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess Malta's chances of qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, we need to consider several factors: 1. This shows a moderate success rate in recent years. 2. Recent results: Malta qualified for the Grand Final in 2021 and 2023, but failed to qualify in 2022. Their most recent performance (2023) saw them finish 11th in the Grand Final, which is a strong result. 3. Selection process: Malta typically uses a national final or internal selection to choose their entry. The quality of their selection process can impact their chances. 4. Eurovision trends: The contest has seen a shift towards more modern, radio-friendly pop songs in recent years. Malta's ability to adapt to these trends could affect their qualification chances. 5. Semi-final draw: The distribution of countries in each semi-final can impact qualification chances. This information is not available yet for 2024. 6. Voting patterns: Malta often receives support from countries like Italy and Australia due to diaspora voting, which can help in qualification. 7. Time until the event: As of the question's creation date, there is still about a year until Eurovision 2024. This leaves time for Malta to prepare a strong entry, but also introduces uncertainty. Given Malta's recent qualification record, their strong performance in 2023, and their ability to often produce competitive entries, they have a good chance of qualifying for the Grand Final in 2024. However, the uncertainty of their future entry's quality and the unknown semi-final draw prevent this from being a very high probability.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. Current polling trends: As of July 5, 2024, Trump is leading Biden by 2.4 points according to 538's national polling average. This is within the range we're looking for (between 2 and 3 points). 2. Time frame: We're forecasting for July 15, 2024, which is only 10 days from the last known data point. In such a short time, dramatic shifts in polling are less likely unless there's a major event. 3. Historical volatility: Presidential polls tend to fluctuate, but usually within a relatively narrow range, especially as we get closer to the election. 4. Potential events: We should consider any known upcoming events that could impact the polls, such as debates, economic reports, or major policy announcements. However, no such events are mentioned in the prompt. 5. Margin of error: Most polls have a margin of error of around 3 percentage points, which means small fluctuations are common and not necessarily indicative of real changes in voter preference. 6. Regression to the mean: If the current 2.4 point lead is seen as unusually high, there might be a tendency for it to regress slightly towards a smaller lead. 7. Timing: July 15 is still several months before the election, so while polls are becoming more predictive, they're not yet at their most accurate point. Given these factors, it seems quite plausible that Trump's lead could remain within the 2 to 3 point range. The current 2.4 point lead is already within this range, and barring any major events, it's reasonable to expect it to stay there. However, there's also a significant chance it could fall below 2 points or rise above 3 points due to normal polling fluctuations or unforeseen events.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index: This index measures the market's expectation of future volatility. A close election race would likely increase this expectation. 7. Market reaction to Trump vs Biden: Markets may react differently depending on which candidate is leading, but with such a close race, this effect might be minimal. Given these factors, I believe there's a strong likelihood that the volatility index will be higher year-over-year. The close race between Trump and Biden, combined with the proximity to the election, would likely increase market uncertainty and expected volatility. question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of Tucker Carlson being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, we need to consider several factors: 1. Current status: Tucker Carlson is not a politician but a conservative political commentator and TV host. He has not announced any intention to run for president. 2. Political experience: Carlson has no prior experience in elected office, which is typically seen as a prerequisite for a presidential nominee. 3. Republican field: There are already several high-profile Republicans who have announced their candidacy or are expected to run, including Donald Trump, Ron DeSantis, Nikki Haley, and others. These candidates have more political experience and established bases of support within the party. 4. Carlson's popularity: While he has a significant following among conservative viewers, it's unclear how this would translate to support from Republican primary voters and convention delegates. 5. Time frame: The question was created in August 2020, and as of now (2023), Carlson has not indicated any plans to run. The timeline for launching a successful presidential campaign is getting short. 6. Recent developments: Carlson was recently fired from Fox News, which could potentially impact his visibility and influence within conservative circles. 7. Historical precedent: It's rare for a media personality with no political experience to become a major party nominee, though not impossible (e.g., Donald Trump in 2016). 8. Party dynamics: The Republican Party typically favors candidates with political experience or those who have previously held elected office. Given these factors, it seems highly unlikely that Tucker Carlson will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. While it's not impossible, the combination of his lack of political experience, the strong field of other candidates, and the absence of any indication that he intends to run make it a very low probability event.

question.title: Given Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question examines the scenario where Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. In this situation, will President Biden drop out or be unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Tucker Carlson must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will not meet the condition.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Resolves NO otherwise.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. Likelihood of Tucker Carlson being the Republican nominee: Tucker Carlson is a popular conservative media figure, but he has not expressed serious interest in running for president. The Republican field is likely to be crowded with more experienced politicians. Therefore, the premise of this question is already quite unlikely. 2. Biden's current position: Joe Biden is the incumbent president and the presumptive Democratic nominee for 2024. Incumbents rarely drop out of races unless there are extraordinary circumstances. 3. Biden's age and health: Biden will be 81 in 2024, which has raised concerns about his ability to serve another term. However, he has maintained that he intends to run for re-election. 4. Democratic Party dynamics: The party is likely to support Biden's re-election bid unless there are significant issues. A sudden dropout would be disruptive to the party's strategy. 5. Timing: July 20 is relatively close to the election. Major party candidates typically solidify their positions well before this date. 6. Reaction to Carlson as the nominee: If Carlson were to become the Republican nominee, it might actually energize Biden and the Democratic base, as Carlson is a polarizing figure. Given these factors, it seems highly unlikely that Biden would drop out before July 20 if Tucker Carlson were the Republican nominee. The premise itself (Carlson as the nominee) is improbable, and even if it occurred, it would not likely cause Biden to exit the race. Biden and the Democratic Party would likely see Carlson as a beatable opponent and would be motivated to stay in the race. The only scenario where this might occur is if Biden faced a sudden, severe health crisis. However, this would be independent of who the Republican nominee is.

question.body:

(b) Biden must drop out or be unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of both conditions occurring, we need to evaluate each separately and then consider their joint probability. (a) Tucker Carlson being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: Tucker Carlson is a popular conservative media figure but has not expressed serious intentions to run for president. He is not currently a politician and has no experience in elected office. The Republican field already has several established politicians like Donald Trump, Ron DeSantis, and others who have declared their candidacy or are expected to do so. The likelihood of the Republican Party choosing a media personality with no political experience over established politicians is very low. Probability for (a): Approximately 0.01 (1%) (b) Biden dropping out before July 20: Joe Biden is the incumbent president and has announced his intention to run for re-election in 2024. While there have been concerns about his age and some calls from within the Democratic Party for new leadership, it is highly unusual for an incumbent president to drop out of a re-election race, especially this early in the process. Biden has consistently stated his intention to run, and his team is actively preparing for the campaign. Barring any severe health issues or unforeseen circumstances, it's unlikely he would drop out before July 20. Probability for (b): Approximately 0.05 (5%) For both events to occur, we need to multiply these probabilities: 0.01 * 0.05 = 0.0005 (0.05%) This extremely low probability reflects the unlikelihood of both these unusual events occurring simultaneously. Tucker Carlson becoming the Republican nominee is already a very low probability event, and combining it with the also unlikely event of Biden dropping out makes the joint probability exceedingly small.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of this event occurring, we need to consider several factors: 1. Current health and cognitive status of President Biden: While there have been concerns and criticisms about Biden's age and occasional gaffes, there is no concrete evidence of severe cognitive decline or health issues that would warrant invoking the 25th Amendment. 2. Political climate and motivation: The context provided mentions a GOP lawmaker asking to invoke the 25th Amendment. This is likely more of a political move rather than a genuine concern about Biden's capacity. Such calls from opposition parties are not uncommon and rarely lead to action. 3. Historical precedent: The 25th Amendment Section 4 has never been invoked in U.S. history. The bar for using this mechanism is extremely high, requiring agreement from the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet. 4. Time frame: The question asks about this happening before August 2024, which is a relatively short time frame (less than a month from the creation date of this question). 5. Support from Biden's administration: There are no indications that Vice President Harris or any significant portion of Biden's Cabinet have expressed concerns about his ability to discharge his duties. 6. Public perception: While there are debates about Biden's age and fitness for office, there isn't widespread public demand for invoking the 25th Amendment. 7. Upcoming election: With the 2024 election approaching, it's highly unlikely that the Democratic party would risk such a drastic and potentially damaging move. Given these factors, the probability of Biden being declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 is extremely low. While it's not impossible, it would require a sudden and severe decline in Biden's health or cognitive abilities, coupled with a rapid shift in the political landscape that would motivate his own administration to take this unprecedented step.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. It would require a severe incapacitation of the President. 2. Time frame: The scenario requires this invocation to happen before August 2024, and then for Biden to die before July 26th, 2024. This is a relatively short window of time. 3. Nature of incapacitation: If Section 4 were to be invoked, it would likely be due to a sudden, severe health crisis. Such a crisis would need to be severe enough to warrant the invocation but not immediately fatal. 5. Survival rates: Modern medical care, especially for a high-profile figure like the President, can often sustain life even in severe conditions. 6. Political considerations: There would be enormous political pressure to avoid invoking Section 4 unless absolutely necessary, and to maintain the President's life if it were invoked. Given these factors, the scenario described is highly improbable. For it to occur, we would need: a) A sudden, severe health crisis for Biden b) The crisis to be severe enough to warrant Section 4 invocation c) The crisis to be fatal within a short time frame, despite top-level medical care While not impossible, this combination of events is extremely unlikely. The probability of all these events occurring in the specified time frame is very low.

question.title: On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. Current market capitalization: As of September 2023, Apple's market cap is significantly larger than Nvidia's. Apple's market cap is around $2.7 trillion, while Nvidia's is around $1.1 trillion. 2. Growth potential: Nvidia has been experiencing rapid growth due to the AI boom and its dominance in the GPU market. Its stock price has more than doubled in 2023. Apple, while still growing, has a more mature and diversified product line. 3. Industry trends: The AI and machine learning industry, where Nvidia is a key player, is expected to continue growing rapidly. Apple's main markets (smartphones, computers, services) are more established but still have growth potential. 4. Time frame: The question is about July 17, 2024, which is less than a year from now. This is a relatively short time for such a significant market cap shift. 5. Market volatility: Tech stocks can be volatile, and market conditions can change rapidly. 6. Competition and innovation: Both companies face competition and need to continue innovating to maintain their positions. Given these factors, it seems unlikely that Nvidia will overtake Apple in market cap by July 2024. While Nvidia is growing rapidly, the gap between the two companies' market caps is still very large. For Nvidia to surpass Apple, it would need to more than double its current market cap while Apple's remains stagnant or decreases, which is improbable in such a short timeframe. However, the rapid growth of AI and Nvidia's strong position in this market does provide some possibility for this outcome, albeit small.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024, we need to consider several factors: 1. Incumbent advantage: Joe Biden is the incumbent president and the presumptive nominee for the Democratic Party. Historically, incumbent presidents rarely face serious primary challenges, and the party typically rallies behind them. 2. Current political landscape: As of the question's creation date (July 8, 2024), there have been no significant challenges to Biden's nomination from within the Democratic Party. 3. Time frame: The resolution date is August 6, 2024, which is likely during or just after the Democratic National Convention. This gives very little time for a serious challenger to emerge and gain enough support to force a brokered convention. 4. Party unity: The Democratic Party has generally been united in its opposition to the Republican Party and would likely want to avoid the appearance of disunity that a brokered convention would suggest. 5. Historical precedent: Brokered conventions are extremely rare in modern American politics. The last time Democrats had a truly brokered convention was in 1952. 6. Biden's performance: While Biden's approval ratings have fluctuated, there hasn't been a catastrophic event or scandal that would likely cause the party to abandon him en masse. 7. Delegate allocation rules: The Democratic Party's proportional allocation of delegates makes it difficult for a challenger to quickly amass enough delegates to prevent a first-ballot nomination. Given these factors, it seems highly unlikely that the Democrats will have a brokered convention in 2024. The only scenario where this might occur would be if Biden were to unexpectedly withdraw very close to the convention due to health issues or a major scandal, leaving the party without a clear alternative. However, even in such a case, the party would likely quickly coalesce around a replacement to avoid a brokered convention.

question.title: Given the Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?

Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, i.e., they have a brokered convention.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as **Yes** if at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the source shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess this scenario, we need to consider several factors: 1. Likelihood of a brokered convention: Brokered conventions are rare in modern US politics. The last time the Democratic Party had one was in 1952. For this to happen, there would need to be significant opposition to Biden within the party. 2. Current support for Biden: As of now, Biden is the presumptive nominee for the Democratic Party in 2024. While there have been some concerns about his age and approval ratings, the party leadership has largely rallied behind him. 3. Time frame: The scenario gives us only about 12 days (from July 8 to July 20) for this situation to unfold. This is a very short period for such a significant political shift. 4. Number of Democratic Senators: There are currently 51 Democratic Senators (including 3 Independents who caucus with Democrats). For 10 or more to call for Biden to drop out would represent a significant portion of the Democratic Senate caucus. 5. Party unity: Democrats typically try to present a united front, especially close to elections. Calling for the incumbent president to drop out would be a major break from this norm. 6. Alternatives: For Senators to call for Biden to drop out, there would need to be a viable alternative candidate who they believe could win the general election. Given these factors, while a brokered convention would certainly indicate serious issues within the party, it seems unlikely that 10 or more Democratic Senators would publicly call for Biden to drop out in such a short time frame. Even in a contentious situation, many would likely prefer to negotiate behind the scenes rather than make public statements that could damage the party's chances in the general election. However, the very fact that there's a brokered convention in this scenario suggests a level of discord that's highly unusual, which does increase the probability of Senators breaking ranks.

question.title: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To estimate the probability of at least 24 world records being broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical data: In the 2020 Tokyo Olympics (held in 2021), 26 world records were broken. In the 2016 Rio Olympics, 27 world records were set. This suggests that breaking 24 or more world records is achievable. 2. Technological advancements: As technology in sports equipment, training methods, and performance analysis continues to improve, athletes are more likely to push the boundaries of human performance. 3. Increased competition: The global pool of elite athletes continues to grow, leading to fiercer competition and potentially more record-breaking performances. 4. Venue and conditions: Paris is known for its moderate climate, which could be conducive to good performances in many events. 5. Time since the last Olympics: With a standard 3-year gap between Tokyo and Paris (instead of the usual 4 years due to the COVID-19 delay), athletes might have less time to improve dramatically, potentially reducing the number of records broken. 6. Maturation of current record holders: Some current world record holders may be past their prime by 2024, making it more likely for their records to be broken. 7. New events: Any new events added to the Olympic program could lead to additional world records being set. 8. Anti-doping efforts: Stricter anti-doping measures might make it more challenging to break records in some events. Considering these factors, it seems quite likely that at least 24 world records will be broken in Paris. The historical precedent from recent Olympics suggests this is achievable, and ongoing advancements in sports science and technology continue to push the limits of human performance. However, the shorter time between Olympics and potential impacts of anti-doping efforts introduce some uncertainty.

The medal table is determined by the total number of medals, ordered by the number of gold, then silver, then bronze medals. If the Olympics do not take place, the outcome resolves ambiguously.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of France placing in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, given that at least 24 world records are broken, we need to consider several factors: 1. Home advantage: As the host country, France will likely benefit from home advantage, which often leads to improved performance in Olympic Games. 2. France's recent Olympic performance: In the 2020 Tokyo Olympics, France finished 8th in the medal table with 33 medals (10 gold, 12 silver, 11 bronze). This suggests they are already close to the Top 5. 3. Correlation between world records and host country performance: The condition of at least 24 world records being broken might indicate favorable conditions for athletes in general, which could benefit the host country as well. 4. France's athletic strengths: France has traditionally been strong in sports like judo, fencing, and swimming, which offer multiple medal opportunities. 5. Investment in Olympic preparation: Host countries often invest heavily in athlete preparation and facilities leading up to the Games, which could boost France's performance. 6. Competition from other countries: The Top 5 typically includes powerhouses like the United States, China, and Russia (if not banned), as well as strong performers like Great Britain, Japan, and Germany. 7. Psychological factor: The excitement of competing at home and the support of the home crowd could motivate French athletes to perform at their best. Given these factors, France has a good chance of improving on their 8th place finish from Tokyo. The home advantage and increased investment in preparation are significant factors that could push them into the Top 5. The condition of many world records being broken suggests optimal conditions for athletes, which could further benefit the host nation. However, breaking into the Top 5 is still a significant challenge given the strong competition from other countries. While France's chances are improved, it's not a certainty.

(2) France places in the top 5 in the medal table, which is calculated by ordering the total number of medals won by each participating country by: (a) Number of Gold Medals, (b) Number of Silver Medals (in case of a tie in Gold), and (c) Number of Bronze Medals (in case of a tie in Silver). question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of Joe Biden announcing he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President before July 15, 2024, we need to consider several factors: 1. Incumbent advantage: Historically, sitting presidents rarely decline to run for a second term unless facing significant health issues or extreme unpopularity. Biden is the incumbent, which gives him a strong position. 2. Age and health concerns: Biden will be 81 at the time of the 2024 election, making him the oldest president in U.S. history. There have been concerns about his age and mental acuity, which could potentially lead to a decision not to run. 3. Current statements and actions: As of now (July 2023), Biden has repeatedly stated his intention to run for re-election and has already launched his 2024 campaign. 4. Party support: The Democratic Party leadership has largely rallied behind Biden, and there's no strong push from within the party for him to step aside. 5. Polling and approval ratings: While Biden's approval ratings have been relatively low, they're not at a level that would typically force an incumbent out of the race. 6. Lack of strong Democratic alternatives: There's no clear successor or alternative candidate who has emerged as a strong contender to replace Biden. 7. Time frame: The question asks about an announcement before July 15, 2024, which is very close to the Democratic National Convention (typically held in August). It's unlikely that a sitting president would wait until so late in the process to announce they're not running. Given these factors, it seems highly unlikely that Biden will announce he's not accepting the nomination before July 15, 2024. While concerns about his age and health are real, the combination of incumbent advantage, his current campaign activities, party support, and the late date specified in the question all point towards him continuing his re-election bid. The only scenarios where this might happen would be a sudden, severe health issue or an unforeseen political scandal of massive proportions, both of which are possible but have a low probability.
