question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. General polling trends: Public opinion polls have consistently shown Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump, while other hypothetical Democratic candidates perform better against Trump. This suggests that Biden is currently less popular than a generic Democrat. 2. Manifold respondents vs. general public: The question asks if Manifold respondents are representative of the general public. While we don't have specific data on Manifold users' demographics or political leanings, we can assume that they might be more politically engaged or informed than the average voter. However, this doesn't necessarily mean their preferences will differ significantly from general polls. 3. The 3% threshold: The question requires Trump to gain at least 3% more votes when facing Biden compared to a generic Democrat. This is a significant difference, considering that many elections are decided by smaller margins. 4. Short timeframe: The polls close on July 6, which is only a few days from the question's creation date. This short timeframe limits the potential for major shifts in opinion or new events that could significantly impact the results. 5. Engaged audience: Manifold users who participate in these polls are likely to be more aware of current polling trends and political dynamics. They might be more inclined to reflect the general trend of Biden performing worse than a generic Democrat against Trump. 6. Potential strategic voting: Some respondents might vote strategically in these polls, either to reflect their actual preferences or to influence the market outcome, which could amplify the difference between Biden and a generic Democrat. Given these factors, it seems likely that Trump will perform better against Biden than against a generic Democrat in these Manifold polls. The consistent trend in public polls, combined with the engaged nature of Manifold users, suggests that this difference will be reflected in the results. However, the 3% threshold is relatively high, which adds some uncertainty.

question.title: Conditional on Trump gaining at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO.

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Suppose the following is true: The percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. Then, will a group of at least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of this scenario, we need to consider several factors: 1. Conditional nature of the question: The scenario only comes into play if Trump gains at least 3% more support when facing Biden compared to a generic Democrat. This condition adds uncertainty to the situation. 2. Time frame: The window for action is relatively short (from July 6 when the polls close to July 20), which limits the time for organizing and executing such a move. 3. Current political climate: There are already reports of discontent among some Democrats, with drafts of letters circulating and some members publicly expressing doubts about Biden's chances. 4. Stakes of the election: The 2024 election is highly consequential, which might make Democrats more willing to take drastic action if they believe Biden can't win. 5. Party loyalty: Despite concerns, many Democrats might be hesitant to publicly undermine the sitting president of their own party. 6. Precedent: It's highly unusual for a party to pressure a sitting president not to run for re-election, especially this late in the cycle. 7. Alternative candidates: The lack of a clear, strong alternative to Biden might make Democrats reluctant to push him out without a solid replacement plan. 8. Biden's resolve: Biden has consistently expressed his intention to run, and it's unclear if he would be receptive to such pressure. Given these factors, I believe there's a significant chance of this scenario occurring, but it's far from certain. If the poll results show a clear advantage for Trump against Biden (compared to a generic Democrat), it could galvanize concerned Democrats into action. The existing reports of draft letters and behind-the-scenes discussions suggest that the groundwork for such a move already exists. However, the short timeframe, the unprecedented nature of such an action, and potential reluctance to publicly undermine the party's leader are significant counterbalancing factors.

(1) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. (2) This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of Joe Biden dropping out before July 20, we need to consider several factors: 1. Current status: As of now, Joe Biden is the incumbent President and the presumptive Democratic nominee for the 2024 election. He has not shown any indication of dropping out. 2. Age and health: Biden is currently 80 years old and would be 82 at the start of a second term. While his age has been a topic of discussion, he has maintained that he is fit for office and has passed medical examinations. 3. Political landscape: The Democratic Party has largely rallied behind Biden, and there is no significant internal challenge to his candidacy. 4. Time frame: The question asks about the period up to July 20, which is relatively close to the election. Major party candidates rarely drop out this late in the election cycle unless there are extraordinary circumstances. 5. Historical precedent: It is extremely rare for an incumbent president to drop out of a re-election race, especially this close to the election. 6. Public statements: Biden and his team have consistently affirmed his intention to run for re-election. 7. Unforeseen circumstances: While unlikely, there's always a small possibility of unexpected health issues or major scandals that could force a candidate to drop out. Given these factors, it seems highly unlikely that Biden would drop out before July 20. The only scenarios where this might happen would be a severe health crisis or an unprecedented political scandal, both of which are very low probability events.

question.title: Given Biden drops out before July 20, will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Mike Pence be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for P: Resolves YES if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Otherwise, resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves YES if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of Mike Pence becoming the Republican nominee in the scenario where Joe Biden drops out before July 20, we need to consider several factors: 1. Likelihood of Biden dropping out: While not impossible, it's highly unlikely that Biden would drop out before July 20. He's the incumbent president and has shown no signs of leaving the race. 2. Republican primary status: As of now, Donald Trump is the clear frontrunner for the Republican nomination, with a significant lead over other candidates. 3. Mike Pence's current position: Pence is not currently a leading contender for the Republican nomination. He's polling far behind Trump and other candidates like Ron DeSantis. 4. Republican Party dynamics: Even if Biden were to drop out, it wouldn't necessarily change the Republican primary dynamics. The party seems to be strongly behind Trump. 5. Pence's relationship with Trump: Pence has distanced himself from Trump since the events of January 6, 2021, which has likely hurt his standing with a significant portion of the Republican base. 6. Convention rules: The Republican National Convention typically confirms the candidate who won the most delegates during the primary process. It's unlikely they would suddenly pivot to Pence unless there were extraordinary circumstances. 7. Other candidates: If there were a sudden need to change candidates, there are other Republicans who might be considered more viable than Pence, such as Ron DeSantis or Nikki Haley. Given these factors, it's highly improbable that Mike Pence would become the Republican nominee, even in the unlikely event of Biden dropping out. The Republican primary process is well underway, and Pence is not in a strong position. The party would be more likely to stick with their current frontrunner or choose a more popular alternative if a change were necessary.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20 and (b) Mike Pence is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. (b) Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of both events occurring, we need to consider each event separately and then combine their probabilities. (a) Biden dropping out before July 20: Joe Biden is the incumbent president and the presumptive Democratic nominee for 2024. While there have been concerns about his age and occasional gaffes, he has consistently expressed his intention to run for re-election. Barring any severe health issues or unforeseen circumstances, it's highly unlikely that Biden would drop out before the Democratic National Convention. The probability of this occurring is very low, perhaps around 5%. (b) Mike Pence being the Republican nominee: Donald Trump is currently the front-runner for the Republican nomination. Other candidates like Ron DeSantis, Nikki Haley, and Tim Scott have more support than Mike Pence. Pence has distanced himself from Trump since the January 6 events, which has reduced his popularity among Trump supporters. While Pence has political experience, he lacks the strong base of support needed to secure the nomination. The probability of Pence becoming the nominee is also very low, perhaps around 2-3%. For both events to occur, we need to multiply these already low probabilities, which results in an extremely low likelihood. Furthermore, these events are not entirely independent - if Biden were to drop out, it might actually decrease the chances of Republicans choosing a less controversial candidate like Pence. Given these factors, the probability of both events occurring is extremely low.

question.title: Conditional on Elon Musk attending Bitcoin Nashville 2024, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This market will resolve YES, if Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

Suppose the following is true: Elon Musk shows up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024.

Then, will Donald Trump be officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for Trump removal: The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question resolves as "Yes" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024, and "No" if they are not.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. The conditional nature of the question: It's important to note that this scenario only comes into play if Elon Musk attends Bitcoin Nashville 2024. While this is not guaranteed, it doesn't directly affect the probability of Trump being removed from ballots. 2. Current legal challenges: As of September 2023, there are ongoing efforts in several states to remove Trump from the ballot based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This amendment prohibits individuals who have engaged in insurrection from holding federal office. 3. Timeline: The question asks about the situation as of July 15, 2024, which is about 10 months from now. This gives ample time for legal challenges to progress through the court system. 4. State-by-state approach: The question only requires one state to remove or block Trump from the ballot. Different states may interpret and apply the 14th Amendment differently. 5. Legal precedent: While there's no modern precedent for using Section 3 of the 14th Amendment in this way, the events of January 6, 2021, and subsequent investigations have created a unique situation. 6. Political climate: The issue is highly politicized, which could influence how aggressively different states pursue this action. 7. Potential Supreme Court involvement: Given the significance of the issue, it's likely that any state-level decision would be appealed, potentially reaching the Supreme Court before the specified date. Considering these factors, I believe there is a significant chance that at least one state will remove or block Trump from the ballot by July 15, 2024. The multiple ongoing efforts, the extended timeline, and the need for only one state to take this action all increase the likelihood. However, the lack of clear precedent and the potential for Supreme Court intervention introduce uncertainty.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of both events occurring, we need to consider each event separately and then combine their probabilities. (b) Donald Trump being removed or blocked from a primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment: This is a complex legal and political issue. However, the legal landscape is evolving, and there are ongoing efforts in various states. The Supreme Court has not yet ruled definitively on this issue. Given the controversial nature of this approach and the potential for legal challenges, I'd estimate the probability of this occurring by July 15, 2024, at around 20%. For both events to occur, we need to multiply these probabilities: 0.30 * 0.20 = 0.06 or 6%. This is a relatively low probability, as it requires two independent events with moderate to low individual probabilities to both occur.

question.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of Fidesz-KDNP maintaining its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024, we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical performance: Fidesz-KDNP has consistently performed well in European Parliament elections. In 2019, they won 13 out of 21 seats allocated to Hungary, securing a clear majority. 2. Current political landscape: Fidesz-KDNP, led by Viktor Orbán, remains the dominant political force in Hungary. They have maintained a strong grip on power at the national level, which often translates to success in European elections. 3. Opposition fragmentation: The Hungarian opposition has historically been divided, making it difficult to mount a unified challenge against Fidesz-KDNP. While there have been attempts at opposition cooperation, it's unclear if this will be effective in the 2024 EU elections. 4. Voter base: Fidesz-KDNP has a loyal and mobilized voter base, particularly in rural areas. This consistent support has been crucial to their electoral success. 5. Media control: The party has significant influence over Hungarian media, which can help shape public opinion in their favor. 6. EU relations: Despite tensions with the EU over rule of law issues, Fidesz-KDNP has managed to maintain support domestically by framing these conflicts as defending Hungarian interests. 7. Time until election: The election is about a month away from the question's creation date, which means that while major shifts are unlikely, there's still some uncertainty about last-minute developments or changes in public opinion. 8. Potential for surprises: While unlikely, there's always a possibility of unexpected events or scandals that could impact the election outcome. Given these factors, Fidesz-KDNP appears to be in a strong position to maintain its plurality. Their consistent performance, strong voter base, and the fragmented opposition work in their favor. However, the proximity to the election date and the potential for unexpected developments introduce some uncertainty.

question.title: Conditional on Fidesz-KDNP maintaining its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024, will the EU announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Fidesz-KDNP maintains its plurality of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament following the 2024 elections, meaning they secure more seats than any other single party or coalition according to credible sources. Given that this condition is met, will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024? This question resolves as **Yes** if credible sources report that before July 5, 2024, the EU has announced new tariffs or duties on Chinese electric vehicle imports.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. Political context: Fidesz-KDNP maintaining its plurality in Hungary suggests a continuation of their current political stance, which tends to be more protectionist and skeptical of China's economic influence. 2. EU-China relations: There has been growing concern in the EU about China's economic practices, particularly in the automotive sector. The EU has been considering measures to protect its domestic industries. 3. Electric vehicle market: Chinese electric vehicles have been gaining market share in Europe, potentially threatening European manufacturers. 4. Timing: The resolution date is less than two months after the creation date, which is a relatively short period for implementing new trade policies. 5. Existing discussions: The EU has already been discussing the possibility of imposing tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles. In September 2023, the European Commission launched an anti-subsidy investigation into Chinese electric vehicles. 6. Global trade tensions: There's an ongoing trend of increased protectionism and trade barriers globally, which could influence EU decision-making. Given these factors, it seems reasonably likely that the EU would announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles. The political climate, existing investigations, and the need to protect European manufacturers all point towards this outcome. However, the short timeframe and the potential for diplomatic negotiations or other unforeseen factors introduce some uncertainty.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Fidesz-KDNP maintains its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024 (b) The EU announces new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources. (b) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider both parts separately and then combine their probabilities. (a) Fidesz-KDNP maintaining EU plurality from Hungary in 2024: Fidesz-KDNP, led by Viktor Orbán, has been the dominant political force in Hungary for over a decade. They have maintained a strong grip on power through various means, including media control and electoral system changes. In the 2019 European Parliament elections, Fidesz-KDNP won 13 out of 21 Hungarian seats. While there has been growing opposition and international criticism of Orbán's government, their support base remains strong, especially in rural areas. The opposition parties have struggled to present a united front. Given their track record and current political landscape, it seems likely that Fidesz-KDNP will maintain their plurality in the 2024 EU elections. I would estimate the probability of this occurring at around 0.75. (b) EU announcing new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024: The EU has been increasingly concerned about the rapid growth of Chinese electric vehicle (EV) imports and their potential impact on European automakers. In September 2023, the European Commission launched an anti-subsidy investigation into Chinese EVs, which could lead to new tariffs. The investigation is expected to conclude by November 2024, but preliminary findings and potential temporary measures could be announced earlier. The EU has a history of imposing tariffs to protect its industries, and there's significant pressure from European automakers to act. However, such decisions are complex and can be influenced by various factors, including diplomatic relations and potential retaliation. Given the ongoing investigation and the timeline provided, I would estimate the probability of the EU announcing new tariffs before July 5, 2024, at around 0.60. To resolve YES, both events need to occur. We multiply the probabilities: 0.75 * 0.60 = 0.45.

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of Poland qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical performance: Poland has qualified for the Grand Final in 8 out of 17 attempts since the introduction of semi-finals in 2004. This gives them a roughly 47% success rate. 2. Recent performance: Poland qualified for the Grand Final in 2022 but failed to qualify in 2023. This suggests some inconsistency in recent years. 3. Quality of entry: As of now, we don't know what Poland's entry for 2024 will be. The quality of the song and performer significantly impacts qualification chances. 4. Voting patterns: Poland often benefits from diaspora voting, particularly from countries like the UK and Ireland, which can help in qualification. 5. Semi-final allocation: The distribution of countries in each semi-final can affect qualification chances. We don't know this information yet for 2024. 6. Changes in format or voting system: Any potential changes to the Eurovision format or voting system could impact qualification chances, but no major changes have been announced for 2024. 7. General competitiveness: The overall quality of entries in their semi-final will affect Poland's chances, but this is unknown at this time. Given these factors, Poland's chances of qualification are somewhat uncertain. Their historical performance suggests they qualify slightly less than half the time, but other factors could swing this in either direction. Without knowing their entry or the semi-final allocation, it's difficult to be more precise. Considering all these factors, I would estimate that Poland has a slightly below average, but still significant chance of qualifying for the Grand Final.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors that could influence the polling average between Donald Trump and Joe Biden on July 15, 2024: 1. Current polling trends: As of July 5, 2024, Trump is leading Biden by 2.4 points. This is within the range we're looking at (2-3 points), but there's still over a week for this to change. 2. Historical volatility: Presidential polling averages tend to fluctuate, but major shifts usually occur due to significant events or debates. Without knowing of any scheduled events between July 5 and July 15, we might expect relatively minor changes. 3. Margin of error: Most polls have a margin of error of around 3 percentage points. This means small changes in the average could easily push the lead in or out of our target range. 4. Time until election: July 15 is still several months before the November 2024 election. Polling averages tend to become more stable and predictive closer to the election date, but at this point, there's still room for significant shifts. 5. Political landscape: Without specific information about major political events or scandals in early July 2024, we have to assume a relatively stable political environment. 6. 538's methodology: 538's polling average is weighted and adjusted, which can sometimes lead to different results compared to simple averages of recent polls. Given that Trump's lead is already at 2.4 points on July 5, it's quite possible that it could remain within the 2-3 point range by July 15. However, there's also a significant chance it could move outside this range in either direction. The narrow range (exactly 1 percentage point) makes this a challenging prediction. If the question asked about a wider range, the probability would be higher. Considering all these factors, I believe there's a moderate chance that Trump's lead will fall within the specified range, but it's far from certain.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's on June 28th, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average. The value is reported as positive for a Trump lead and negative for a Biden lead, and this is verified on July 17, 2024.

Then, is it true that on June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's according to Companies Market Cap, as checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC)?

metadata.chain_of_thought: This question involves two separate events that are not directly related: Trump's polling lead over Biden and the market capitalization comparison between Nvidia and Apple. Let's break down each component: 1. Trump's polling lead: The condition is that Trump leads Biden by more than 2 but not more than 3 points on July 15, 2024. This is a fairly specific range, and while polls can fluctuate, such a lead for Trump is plausible given the current political climate and historical trends. 2. Nvidia vs. Apple market cap: This comparison is to be made on June 28, 2024, which is about two weeks before the polling date. As of 2023, Apple's market cap is significantly larger than Nvidia's. For Nvidia to overtake Apple would require a substantial shift in the market. Factors to consider: a) Nvidia has been experiencing significant growth due to the AI boom, while Apple's growth has been more steady. b) However, Apple is a much larger and more diversified company, making it less likely to be overtaken in market cap. c) Market conditions can change rapidly, especially in the tech sector. d) The timeframe (about a year from now) is long enough for significant market changes to occur. The relationship between these two events is not clear, and they seem to be independent. The polling numbers for the 2024 election are unlikely to have a direct, significant impact on the relative market caps of these two companies. Given Nvidia's recent growth trajectory and the excitement around AI, there's a possibility it could continue to grow rapidly. However, overtaking Apple, which has a much larger market cap, is still a tall order. The specific polling numbers for Trump vs. Biden don't seem to provide any additional information that would affect this outcome. Considering all these factors, I believe there's a small but not negligible chance that Nvidia could overtake Apple in market cap by the specified date, regardless of the polling numbers.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider both parts (a) and (b) separately and then combine their probabilities. (a) Trump's lead over Biden: As of now (June 2023), it's still early to predict the exact polling numbers for July 2024. However, we can consider some factors: 1. Incumbent presidents often face challenges in their re-election bids. 2. The economy, international relations, and domestic issues can significantly influence polling numbers. 3. question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of the Greens–EFA holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, we need to consider several factors: 1. Current representation: In the 2019 European Parliament elections, the Greens–EFA won 74 seats out of 751, making them the fourth-largest group. This is significantly behind the largest groups like the European People's Party (EPP) and the Progressive Alliance of Socialists and Democrats (S&D). 2. Historical trends: The Greens–EFA has been growing in recent elections, but they have never been close to being the largest group in the European Parliament. 3. Political climate: Environmental issues have gained prominence in recent years, which could benefit the Greens–EFA. However, other pressing issues like economic concerns, migration, and security might take precedence in voters' minds. 4. Competition: Traditional center-right and center-left parties (EPP and S&D) have historically dominated the European Parliament. Other groups like Renew Europe and Identity and Democracy have also been gaining ground. 5. National politics: The performance of Green parties in national elections across EU member states has been mixed, with some gains but not consistent dominance. 6. Polling: While specific polling for the 2024 European elections is not yet widely available, general trends do not indicate a massive surge for Green parties across Europe that would be necessary to overtake the larger groups. 7. Structural challenges: The Greens–EFA primarily draws support from Western and Northern European countries, with less representation in Eastern and Southern Europe, limiting their potential for significant growth. Given these factors, it seems highly unlikely that the Greens–EFA will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections. While they may continue to grow and potentially improve their position, overtaking the traditionally dominant groups would require an unprecedented and currently unforeseen shift in European politics.

question.title: If Greens–EFA holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

Then, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024? The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. Likelihood of Greens-EFA holding the most seats: The Greens-EFA group is currently the fourth-largest group in the European Parliament. While they have been gaining popularity in recent years due to increased environmental concerns, it's still unlikely that they would become the largest group after the 2024 elections. This part of the question makes the overall probability quite low. 2. EU AI regulation: The EU is currently working on the AI Act, which aims to regulate AI systems. ChatGPT and similar large language models are likely to fall under this regulation. The final version of the Act is expected to be implemented before the 2024 elections. 3. OpenAI's compliance efforts: OpenAI has shown willingness to work with regulators. They temporarily shut down ChatGPT in Italy when concerns were raised and then worked to address those concerns. This suggests they are likely to try to comply with EU regulations. 4. Time frame: By June 30, 2024, there will have been ample time for OpenAI to adapt to any new EU regulations. Even if there are initial challenges, they are likely to have been resolved by this date. 5. EU's stance on AI: While the EU is cautious about AI, they also recognize its potential benefits. A complete ban on ChatGPT is unlikely, especially given the competitive implications in the global AI race. 6. Greens-EFA's potential influence: If Greens-EFA were to hold the most seats (which is unlikely), they might push for stricter environmental and technological regulations. However, their influence would be balanced by other political groups and EU institutions. Given these factors, I believe it's quite likely that ChatGPT will be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, regardless of the election outcome. The main factor reducing the probability is the unlikelihood of Greens-EFA holding the most seats.

question.body:

If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider both parts (a) and (b) separately and then combine their probabilities. (a) Greens–EFA holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections: The Greens–EFA (European Free Alliance) is currently the fourth-largest group in the European Parliament. In the 2019 elections, they won 74 seats out of 751, which is about 9.85% of the total. The largest group, the European People's Party (EPP), won 182 seats (24.23%). For the Greens–EFA to become the largest group, they would need to more than double their seat count while other major parties lose seats. While environmental issues are becoming increasingly important to European voters, such a dramatic shift in voting patterns seems highly unlikely. The Greens–EFA would need to outperform not only the EPP but also the S&D (Socialists and Democrats) and Renew Europe groups. Based on current polling and political trends, this scenario is very improbable. I would estimate the probability of this part at around 0.05 or 5%. (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT being generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024: ChatGPT is currently available in most EU countries, with some temporary exceptions (like the brief ban in Italy). The EU is working on AI regulations, including the AI Act, which could potentially impact ChatGPT's availability. However, it's more likely that regulations will focus on transparency, safety, and ethical use rather than outright bans. OpenAI has shown willingness to work with regulators and adapt their products to meet legal requirements. By June 2024, it's likely that any regulatory issues will have been addressed, allowing ChatGPT to remain available in the EU. I would estimate the probability of this part at around 0.85 or 85%. Combined probability: For both events to occur, we need to multiply their individual probabilities: 0.05 * 0.85 = 0.0425.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the likelihood of "Twisters" (2024) achieving a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%, we need to consider several factors: 1. Director: Lee Isaac Chung is known for his critically acclaimed film "Minari," which received a 98% score on Rotten Tomatoes. This suggests he has the ability to create films that resonate with critics. 2. Cast: Glen Powell and Daisy Edgar Jones are both rising stars with strong performances in recent projects. Their involvement could contribute to a positive reception. 3. Genre and Expectations: As a disaster movie sequel, "Twisters" might face higher scrutiny. The original "Twister" (1996) has a 63% score, which sets a benchmark but also leaves room for improvement. 4. Technological Advancements: Given the 28-year gap between films, the visual effects for "Twisters" are likely to be significantly more advanced, which could impress critics if used effectively. 5. Standalone Sequel: Being a standalone sequel rather than a direct continuation might allow for more creative freedom and a fresh approach, potentially appealing to critics. 6. Current Trends: There's been a recent trend of well-received "legacy sequels" (e.g., Top Gun: Maverick), which could work in the film's favor. 7. Critical Reception Unpredictability: Despite these positive factors, critical reception can be unpredictable, especially for big-budget spectacle films. 8. Time for Critical Consensus: The one-week period after release should be sufficient for a reliable Tomatometer score to form. While there are several positive indicators, achieving a 75% or higher score is still a significant challenge. The original's 63% score and the general critical reception of disaster movies suggest caution. However, the involvement of a critically acclaimed director and the potential for a fresh take on the concept provide reasons for optimism.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined, given "Twisters" (2024) is "Certified Fresh"?

Given these factors, I believe it's highly likely that 'Deadpool & Wolverine' will surpass the combined opening weekend box office of its predecessors. Considering all these factors, I believe there's a high probability of both 'Twisters' being Certified Fresh and 'Deadpool & Wolverine' surpassing the target box office number.

"Deadpool & Wolverine" box office opening: - The combined opening weekend for "Deadpool" ($132,434,639) and "The Wolverine" ($53,113,752) is $185,548,391. - "Deadpool & Wolverine" combines two highly popular characters from the X-Men universe. - Both Deadpool movies were very successful, with "Deadpool 2" opening at $125,507,153. - Hugh Jackman's return as Wolverine has generated significant buzz. - The Marvel Cinematic Universe connection could potentially boost interest. - However, recent superhero movie fatigue and mixed reception of some recent Marvel films could impact performance. - Given the combined star power and anticipation, I'd estimate the chances of surpassing the $185,548,391 threshold at about 75%. question.title: Will Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdon at D23 2024?
question.body: This will resolve YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of Disney announcing a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024, we need to consider several factors: 1. Popularity of Moana: The movie has been a significant success for Disney, and its popularity has remained strong since its release in 2016. This makes it a good candidate for a theme park attraction. 2. Existing Moana presence: Disney has already incorporated Moana into its parks in various ways, including meet-and-greets and the 'Journey of Water' attraction at EPCOT. This shows Disney's commitment to the IP. 3. Magic Kingdom's current offerings: Magic Kingdom is Disney World's flagship park, and it's always looking for new attractions to keep visitors engaged. A Moana ride could fit well with the park's theme and add diversity to its offerings. 4. Disney's recent focus: Disney has been emphasizing the integration of its popular IPs into its parks. We've seen this with Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge and the upcoming Frozen land at Hong Kong Disneyland. 5. Timing: The D23 convention is a prime opportunity for Disney to make big announcements. With the convention happening in August 2024, it gives Disney ample time to develop plans for a new attraction. 6. Competition: Universal Studios is opening a new park in Orlando (Epic Universe) in 2025, which might push Disney to announce new attractions to maintain interest. 7. Economic factors: Theme park investments are expensive, and Disney has faced some financial challenges recently. This could potentially limit new ride announcements. 8. Previous D23 announcements: Disney has a history of announcing new attractions at D23, but they also sometimes discuss ideas without firm commitments. 9. Specificity of the question: The question is very specific about the ride being for Magic Kingdom, not any other park, which narrows the possibilities. Given these factors, I believe there's a moderate chance of this happening. Disney has good reasons to consider a Moana ride for Magic Kingdom, and D23 2024 would be an excellent time to announce it. However, the specificity of the question (Magic Kingdom only) and the possibility of economic constraints slightly lower the probability.

question.title: Conditional on Disney announcing a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024, will Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
This question explores the potential correlation between two independent events: Disney's announcement of a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024, and the box office performance of the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.

Criterion for the condition: Resolves YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It resolves NO if it is only discussed as an idea or if announced for a different park.

Criterion for the outcome: Resolves YES if "Deadpool x Wolverine" grosses more than $284.5M globally in its opening weekend and is reported as the record for an R-rated movie release by the Hollywood Reporter or equivalent publication. Resolves NO otherwise.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors: 1. Likelihood of the condition being met: Disney has been expanding its theme park attractions based on popular franchises. Moana has been a successful Disney property, with a sequel announced for November 2024. However, there's no concrete information about a Moana ride for Magic Kingdom being planned. 2. 'Deadpool x Wolverine' box office potential: The movie combines two highly popular Marvel characters. Both Deadpool movies were very successful, with Deadpool 2 grossing $785 million worldwide. This will be the first Deadpool movie in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU), potentially attracting a wider audience. Hugh Jackman's return as Wolverine adds significant star power and nostalgia factor. 3. Current R-rated opening weekend record: The record is held by 'Deadpool 2' with $284.5 million globally. 4. Factors that could boost 'Deadpool x Wolverine' performance: MCU integration and potential cameos from other Marvel characters. Pent-up demand for R-rated superhero content in the MCU. Strong marketing push expected from Disney/Marvel. 5. Potential challenges: R-rating may limit audience size compared to typical MCU releases. Competition from other summer blockbusters. Given these factors, I believe there's a strong chance that 'Deadpool x Wolverine' will break the R-rated opening weekend record, regardless of the Moana ride announcement. The combination of Deadpool and Wolverine, plus the MCU connection, creates a powerful draw that could easily surpass the previous Deadpool movies' performance. However, the condition of Disney announcing a Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024 adds uncertainty. While it's possible, there's no strong indication that such an announcement is imminent. The lack of correlation between the two events means that the Moana ride announcement doesn't significantly impact the probability of the box office success. Considering all these factors, I believe there's a good chance of both the condition being met and the movie breaking the record, but the uncertainty of the Moana ride announcement slightly lowers the overall probability.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024 (b) Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
This question will resolve YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

(b) The "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie grosses more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend according to reports, and the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release. Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for the film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, with expectations between $340 million and $360 million globally. Domestically, it is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time. The record for the biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic). BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To resolve YES, both conditions (a) and (b) must be met. Let's analyze each condition separately: (a) Disney announcing a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024: Disney has been expanding its IP-based attractions, and Moana is a popular franchise. However, there's no concrete evidence or rumors about a Moana ride for Magic Kingdom. The question specifies it must be for Magic Kingdom, not any other park. The announcement must be definitive, not just a discussion of ideas. D23 is a major event where Disney often announces new attractions, but not all planned attractions are announced there. Given these factors, while possible, it's not highly likely that Disney will announce a Moana ride specifically for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024. I'd estimate this at about 30% probability. (b) Deadpool & Wolverine having the biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie: The current record is $284.5M globally. Analysts are projecting an opening weekend between $340M and $360M globally. The film combines two highly popular characters from the Marvel universe. Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman have strong fan bases. The previous Deadpool movies were very successful. There's high anticipation for this crossover. Given these factors, it seems highly likely that Deadpool & Wolverine will break the R-rated opening weekend record. I'd estimate this at about 85% probability. For both events to occur, we multiply the probabilities: 0.30 * 0.85 = 0.255.

question.title: Will Belgium qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of Belgium qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, we need to consider several factors: 1. Historical performance: Belgium has qualified for the Grand Final in 7 out of the last 10 contests they participated in (2013-2023, excluding 2020 which was cancelled). This gives them a 70% success rate in recent years. 2. Recent results: Belgium qualified for the Grand Final in both 2022 and 2023, indicating a positive trend in their performance. 3. Quality of entries: Belgium has been sending generally well-received entries in recent years, with a mix of different genres and styles that have appealed to both juries and televotes. 4. Competition format: The Semi-finals typically feature around 15-18 countries, with 10 qualifying from each. This gives each country roughly a 55-60% chance of qualifying, assuming equal quality of entries. 5. Voting patterns: Belgium tends to receive consistent support from neighboring countries like the Netherlands and France, which can help in the voting process. 6. Artist and song selection: As of now (April 2024), we don't know who will represent Belgium or what their song will be. This introduces some uncertainty into the prediction. 7. Performance draw: The running order in the Semi-final can have an impact on qualification chances, but this is not known at this time. Given Belgium's strong recent track record and their ability to consistently produce competitive entries, I believe they have a better than average chance of qualifying. However, the unknown factors (artist, song, draw) prevent us from being overly confident. Considering all these factors, I would estimate that Belgium has a good chance of qualifying, but it's not a certainty.

Correlation: There's no direct correlation between Belgium and Czechia's performances. They are not neighboring countries and don't typically exchange points based on geographical or cultural proximity. 3. Semi-final allocation: We don't know which semi-final each country will be in. If they're in different semi-finals, their chances of qualification are even less related. 4. Considering Czechia's improving track record and the general qualification rate, but also accounting for the uncertainty of future performances and voting patterns, I would estimate a moderate probability of Czechia qualifying if Belgium does.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors that could influence the polling average between Donald Trump and Joe Biden on July 15, 2024: 1. Current polling trends: As of July 5, 2024, Trump is leading Biden by 2.4 points. This is within the range we're looking at (2-3 points), but there's still time for changes. 2. Historical polling volatility: Presidential polls can fluctuate, especially as we get closer to the election. The period between July 5 and July 15 is relatively short, so dramatic changes are less likely, but not impossible. 3. Campaign events: Any major campaign events, debates, or controversies occurring between now and July 15 could shift poll numbers. 4. Economic indicators: The state of the economy often plays a significant role in presidential polling. Any major economic news could impact the numbers. 5. International events: Significant international developments could affect voters' perceptions of the candidates' leadership capabilities. 6. Margin of error: Most polls have a margin of error, typically around 3 percentage points. This means small changes in the average might not be statistically significant. 7. 538's methodology: 538's polling average takes into account multiple polls and weights them based on various factors. This tends to smooth out extreme fluctuations. Given that Trump is already leading by 2.4 points on July 5, and considering the relatively short timeframe until July 15, it seems reasonably likely that his lead could remain within the 2-3 point range. However, there's also a significant chance it could fall below 2 points or rise above 3 points. The question asks for a very specific range (greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3), which narrows the probability. If we assume a normal distribution of possible outcomes centered around the current 2.4 point lead, a lead between 2 and 3 points would represent a sizable portion of the probable outcomes, but not the majority.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. This is determined by accessing 538's national polling average chart on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is it true that before May 1, 2024, credible reports will indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals? The attack must occur after the publication of this question and before May 1, 2024, to be considered.

metadata.chain_of_thought: This question involves two separate events that are not directly related, making it a complex prediction. Let's break it down: 1. Trump's lead over Biden: This condition is set for July 15, 2024, which is after the resolution date for the Israel-Iran conflict part of the question. Therefore, this condition doesn't directly affect the probability of the attack occurring. 2. Israel's attack on Iran: The question asks about a deadly attack by Israel within Iran's borders before May 1, 2024. Several factors need to be considered: a) Historical context: Israel and Iran have been in a state of hostility for decades, with occasional covert operations and cyber attacks. b) Current tensions: As of the question's creation date (April 13, 2024), tensions between Israel and Iran are likely to be high due to ongoing regional conflicts and Iran's nuclear program. c) Time frame: The window for this attack is from April 13, 2024, to May 1, 2024 - a period of about 18 days. d) Severity of the attack: The question specifies at least five deaths, which is a relatively low threshold for a military operation. Given these factors, there's a significant possibility of such an attack occurring: 1. The short time frame (18 days) reduces the likelihood, as military operations often require longer planning. 2. However, the low death toll requirement (5 individuals) makes it more plausible, as even a small-scale operation could meet this criterion. 3. The ongoing tensions between Israel and Iran increase the likelihood of conflict. 4. Israel has a history of conducting covert operations against Iran, which adds to the probability. Considering all these factors, I believe there is a moderate chance of such an attack occurring within the given timeframe.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (2) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

2. Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of this compound event, we need to consider the likelihood of both conditions occurring independently and then multiply those probabilities. 1. Trump's lead over Biden between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024: The 2024 election is still over a year away, and polling averages can fluctuate significantly. As of now (April 2023), polls show a close race between Trump and Biden. While Trump has been leading in some polls, a lead of exactly 2-3 points is a narrow range. Given the time until the specified date and the volatility of political polling, this condition has a moderate probability of occurring. Let's estimate this at around 20%. 2. Israel carrying out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024: Tensions between Israel and Iran have been high for years, with occasional covert operations and cyber attacks. However, a direct, deadly attack by Israel within Iran's borders would be a significant escalation. While not impossible, such an action would carry enormous risks and potential for wider conflict. Israel typically prefers covert operations or strikes on Iranian-linked targets outside of Iran itself. The timeframe (about a year) does provide some opportunity for escalation, but the condition of at least five deaths makes this less likely. Let's estimate this probability at around 15%. For both events to occur, we multiply these probabilities: 0.20 * 0.15 = 0.03 or 3%. This low probability reflects the compound nature of the question - both specific events need to occur for a 'Yes' resolution.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

metadata.chain_of_thought: To answer this question, we need to consider several factors that influence the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) and compare the current economic situation with potential scenarios for July 2024. Historical context: The VXVCLS is a measure of expected volatility in the S&P 500 index over the next three months. It tends to increase during periods of economic uncertainty or market stress. Current economic situation: As of April 2024, the global economy is still recovering from the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic, with various challenges such as inflation, supply chain issues, and geopolitical tensions. Comparison to July 2023: We need to consider the economic conditions and market sentiment in July 2023 as a baseline. Without specific data for that date, we can assume it was a period of relative stability as the world continued to recover from the pandemic. Potential factors affecting volatility in July 2024: a) Monetary policy: Central banks' decisions on interest rates and quantitative easing could impact market volatility. b) Geopolitical events: Ongoing conflicts or new tensions could increase uncertainty. c) Economic recovery: The pace and sustainability of economic growth could influence market sentiment. d) Technological disruptions: Rapid advancements or setbacks in key industries could affect market stability. e) Natural disasters or new health crises: Unforeseen events could significantly impact market volatility. Time frame: The question is asking about a specific date (July 20, 2024) which is about three months from the resolution date. This relatively short time frame makes it somewhat less likely for significant changes to occur compared to the previous year. Mean reversion: Volatility indices tend to revert to their mean over time, which suggests that unless there are significant new factors, the index might not be dramatically different from the previous year. Given these considerations, it's difficult to predict with high confidence whether the VXVCLS will be higher year-over-year on July 20, 2024. The global economy is likely to continue facing challenges, but it's also possible that many of the current uncertainties will have been resolved by then. The short time frame and tendency for mean reversion suggest that a dramatic increase is less likely. However, given the ongoing economic uncertainties and the potential for unforeseen events, I believe there's a slightly higher chance that the index will be higher rather than lower compared to the previous year.

question.title: Conditional on the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index being higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question combines two conditions:

1. **Condition**: The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) must be higher on July 20, 2024, than it was on July 20, 2023. This will be verified based on the St. Louis Fed's reporting at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

2. **Outcome of Interest**: Israel must carry out a deadly attack within Iran's borders resulting in the death of at least five individuals, as indicated by credible reports, between the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024.

The question resolves **Yes** if both conditions are met, **No** if the first condition is met but the second is not, and **N/A** if the first condition is not met.

metadata.chain_of_thought: This question requires analyzing two separate conditions, which makes it complex. Let's break it down: 1. CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) condition: The volatility index is a measure of market expectations of near-term volatility. Given the current global economic uncertainties, geopolitical tensions, and potential for market disruptions, it's plausible that the volatility index could be higher in July 2024 compared to July 2023. However, predicting market volatility over a year in advance is challenging and subject to many unpredictable factors. 2. Israel carrying out a deadly attack within Iran: The relationship between Israel and Iran has been tense for years, with both countries engaging in covert operations against each other. However, a direct, overt attack by Israel within Iran's borders resulting in at least five deaths would be a significant escalation. Such an action would carry enormous risks, including potential retaliation and international condemnation. Considering recent events: - The ongoing conflict between Israel and Hamas has increased tensions in the region. - Iran's continued nuclear program development is a major concern for Israel. - There have been incidents of sabotage and cyberattacks attributed to both countries. However, a direct attack by Israel on Iranian soil would be a major escalation from the current state of affairs. Israel has generally preferred covert operations or strikes on Iranian-linked targets outside of Iran itself. The timeframe for this potential attack (before May 1, 2024) is relatively short, which reduces the likelihood of such a significant event occurring. Given these factors, I believe it's unlikely that Israel will carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024. The volatility index condition is more likely to be met, but still uncertain. Considering both conditions need to be met for a 'Yes' resolution, and the attack condition seems particularly unlikely, I would assign a low probability to this outcome.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of Tucker Carlson becoming the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, we need to consider several factors: 1. Current status: Tucker Carlson is not a politician but a prominent conservative media personality, primarily known for his Fox News show. 2. Political experience: Carlson has no prior experience in elected office or government administration, which is typically seen as a prerequisite for presidential candidates. 3. Declared candidacy: As of now, Carlson has not declared any intention to run for president or shown interest in doing so. 4. Competition: There are already several high-profile Republican candidates in the race, including former President Donald Trump, Florida Governor Ron DeSantis, and others with significant political experience and support bases. 5. Party dynamics: The Republican Party typically favors candidates with political experience and a track record in governance. 6. Media role: Carlson's current position as a media figure might be seen as more influential than a political role, potentially discouraging him from running. 7. Public opinion: While Carlson has a strong conservative following, his controversial statements and lack of political experience might make him less appealing to a broader Republican base. 8. Time factor: The question's resolution date is August 1, 2024, which is likely after the Republican National Convention. This means there's still time for unexpected developments, but also that the field of candidates is already forming without Carlson's involvement. Given these factors, it seems highly unlikely that Tucker Carlson would become the Republican nominee. He has not shown interest in running, lacks political experience, and would face stiff competition from established political figures. While unexpected events can occur in politics, the probability of Carlson becoming the nominee is very low.

Given these factors, I believe the Republican Party is still likely to retain this seat: 1. metadata.chain_of_thought: To assess the probability of Nikki Haley becoming the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, we need to consider several factors: 1.
